data.text:
GUNBIR SINGH PRESENT: 1. President, Dilbir Foundation (Ecology/Education/Legacy/Innovation/Causes) 2. Chairperson, Punjab State, Worldwide Fund for Nature (WWF-India) since 2008 3. Founder Chairman, Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) - Amritsar Zonal Council (2005-2009). 4. Chairman, Eco Amritsar (2013-2017) 5. Patron, PAANI Collective (2019>) 6. Chairman CII-Punjab State (2009-10), Member CII Northern Regional Council (2010-11), Member CII National Council on Public Policy (2011-13), Member CII Council on Good Governance (2012>) 7. Member Consultative Review Group, National Planning Commission for Empowerment of Minorities (Last 5-year plan) 8. Financial Secretary, Khalsa College Charitable Society, Amritsar (2004>). 9. Vice President, Bhai Vir Singh Niwas Asthaan. 10. Senator, Guru Nanak Dev University 11. Member Sri Guru Singh Sabha. STRENGTHS: - Goal oriented with a sense of loyalty and fairness. - Wide Spectrum experience in manufacturing, marketing, facilitation and hospitality & event management, and decades of public life serving community affairs. - Devoted to welfare activities, with an accent on environment, academics, spirituality, legacy conservation and social upliftment. COMMUNITY AFFAIRS & SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: After three decades of experience in corporate & business life, invested the last two decades in public life and community service especially in varied fields: Influencer for social change: Created programs and spearheaded action for public participation in keeping cities clean, of citizens taking responsibility, of NGO’s coming together for common cause, of interfaith dialogue and significant people’s action for nation building & social upliftment. Creating slogans & mottos of pride such as “My City, My Pride, My Responsibility!” which find application in every corner of the nation to spur public participation in responsible action. Thought Leader: Through advocacy & media interaction working constantly with the government to bring about a change in the environment & ecology, advocating issues of import to usher better community understanding & lifestyles, writing OPEDs, articles in print media on social issues, as well as projecting areas for change on state and national visual interactions. Raising voice against deforestation, emptying aquifers & degraded surface water sources, air pollution and soil degradation. Spearheading movements for better environmental action by people starting from their own homes & community spaces. Natural Farm Outreach: Interacting with the farm community across Punjab, and beyond to Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Kerala & Haryana to bring to the fore best practices in natural cultivation, crop diversification, Seed to Fork supply chains. Creation of support groups for Greenfield organic farmers, watching & nurturing their progress in value added farm economy. Leading the movement against excessive chemical usage in cultivation & food chains, as well as action towards adoption of non- thirsty crops and native species. Citizens Pure Food & Wellness Platforms: Creating platforms for natural farmers and citizens to meet such as the popular weekly Organic Farmers Markets at Amritsar & Ludhiana, as well as creation of The Earth Stores to assist farmers across Punjab & North India to market their produce directly to consumers. Ensuring ethically packed & produced merchandise in keeping with national & international standards. Outreach for Awareness of Sustainable Households: Running successful hashtagged outreach programs #NoMorePoisonInMyFood & #SayNoToPlastic on social media thus creating a surge towards pure foods & exposing unhealthy practices, and urging sustainable living. ACTION ORIENTATION: 1. Industry: Led number of industry and trade delegations to meet successive Union and State Minister to advocate the cause of commerce & society. Also participated in a number of industrial fora to further the cause of Industrial development. Prepared Vision Punjab 2012 on behalf of CII and presented to CM, Punjab 05May2007. 2. Community Engagements: - Prepared Amritsar Vision Paper and presented to the Prime Minister, Dr. Manmohan Singh. Also represented the city on the Divisional Planning Board for the Eighth Five-Year Plan. - Served as Hon. Sec, SSSS Group of institutions (2002-08). - Devised a Roadmap for saving water of Punjab - PAANI (Prevention of Attrition to Assets in Nature Initiative) lauded by Punjab Government in 2009. - Represented Sikh interest on Committee on Minorities with National Planning Commission in 2011 - Mission 2017 for a clean and green Holy City of Amritsar on its 440th year of establishment - Afforestation Programs, Natural Farming engagements, Zero Disposal Households & EcoFriendly institutions. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nNesRhJ3du4 - Leading from front the Green Nagar Kirtan Movement, Organic Langar Program, Sikh Environment Day & Amritsar Foundation Day celebrations on the wisdom of “Pavan Guru Paani Pita Mata Dharat Mahat”. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLvdkAjUMo8 - Engagement with the children and youth on matters of ecology through World Wide Fund For nature since 2008. - Representing Amritsar environmental interests to Montgomery county delegation https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H1SF-T8sv9k - Engaging community towards environmental sustainability by Celebrating Earth Hour (WWF-India) every year since 2012 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q67dgZ-Wiz4 - Amritsar has been adjudged as one of the top 12 Indian Green Cities by the Earth Day Network prevalent in 192 nations. The project acknowledged is Dilbir Foundation’s Organic Marketplace initiative: https://www.facebook.com/pg/Earth.Day.Network.India/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1535741219780144 - Advocacy for the city of Amritsar…wish lists to Prime Minister, Union Finance Minister, State ministers from time to time https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxt6_XmWWCM - Amritsar has been adjudged as one of the top 12 Indian Green Cities by the Earth Day Network prevalent in 192 nations in 2017. The only project acknowledged by the network is Dilbir Foundation’s Organic Marketplace initiative: https://www.facebook.com/pg/Earth.Day.Network.India/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1535741219780144 - Started PAANI Collective in July 2019 to showcase the need to refill ground aquifers of Punjab through solutions for citizens, institutions & business. 3. Awards: - Parman Patra, State Award for Service to Society(15Aug 2019 Govt. of Punjab) https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=2915546408460975&id=100000169339629 - Shri Anandpur Sahib Award for Service to Environment (18April 2018) presented at Virasat-e-Khalsa. - Earth Day Network Green City Award to Amritsar for Organic Farmers Market initiative by Dilbir Foundation in 2017 4. Welfare: -As the youngest President of Rotary Club Amritsar Cantt., and thenceforth through various fora including the Siri Guru Singh Sabha, Khalsa College Charitable Society and Dilbir Foundation, endeavour to make a positive difference. 5. International Engagements: - Led the CII delegation in 2010with CM Punjab to Turkey, Egypt, Israel and UAE To build momentum for business and research for ultimate development of Punjab with an accent on water, environment & agriculture. - Chaired the Session On Trans-boundary Aquifers in the Indus Basin: Challenges and Opportunities during Indo Pak Roundtable on Water- in Feb 2014 as part of Track II diplomacy at Bangalore. - Presented “Environmental Stewardship In South Asia: Common Challenges, Integrated Responses (Focus Water) at Lahore in Oct 2013. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mqohO3_jKIo - Represented the community from India in 2014 for The Gathering of Faith Leaders in Japan on Faith, Customs and Traditions for Sustainable Lifestyles under the UN Charter for SDG’s 2015-2030. INTERESTS: 1. Authorship. Also writing on various issues concerning society. Editorials, OPED’s & Articles published from time to time in The Tribune (English & Punjabi), Hindustan Times, Daily Ajit, The Indian Express, Punjabi Jagran, The Times of India, India Today, New York Times and The Sikh Review among others. Oft quoted in The Economic Times & Business Standard as well. 2. Live interviews on ANI, API, NDTV, CNBC, BBC, Namaste India in America, Doordarshan etc. 3. Fond of good music, whether spiritual, classical or western. 4. Avid traveler, been-there-done-that in trekking, hiking and mobiking, and travel to various destinations overseas. 5. Meditation and spirituality. EDUCATION: ICSE, B.COM, Management in International Trade. BORN: 14 May 1960 FAMILY: Wife & two grown up sons.
